reviews.review_msg: Nora is such a sweetheart. Fall 2017 was her first year teaching and not as a TA as she mentioned in the last class. However, the slides were lengthy and full and she often read completely off the slides. 2 exams and 1 optional paper to boost your midterm mark if needed. If u go over the slides and understand the material u will do great!

She's very nice and really tries to connect with students, but she lacks teaching experiences. Pros: paper is optional, no project or assignments, dont need txtbk Cons: Iclicker questions at start of every 8:30 class, midterm and final are hard (cumulative too), midterm 40% final 50% so if u fail final.. gg I wouldnt recommend taking this :(

Nora has a lot of potential - she's got great enthusiasm and you can tell she wants to connect with the class, but she's not there yet. She reads information directly off the slides, but since participation is 10% (iClicker questions aren't very engaging, either) you have to sit through the lectures which you could otherwise just read online.

I thought Nora was a really caring teacher, but I just personally didn't like her teaching style. It was good that she wanted to be extra clear, but a lot of times I felt like she spoke to the class like we weren't very smart or were a lot younger. Overall good though, and it was an easy course. Show up and you will do just fine

2 exams are 90%. 10% iclicker at 8:30am. For how exam heavy this course is (relatively few questions on each too, all MC) it is surprising how little direction was given (no mock exam). Required to read textbook, but unclear as to what to focus on ->Too much memorization. I'm disappointed, but hopefully she'll get better with more experience. :/

Had her for personality psyc. She is amazing! Explains everything very well, and her slides give all the information that you need. Exams are super easy too as long as you go through slides. She's very compassionate as well and seems to care about her students success. She even boosted our class marks for our exam by 3 points.
